author: lgo
msg: On the 1.3.x branch:
Merge fixes from trunk:
r2011+2012: Improve conformance to RFC2616: don't expect body for certain
responses.
r2144: Do not invoke progress callback if no data received from network.
r2146: Fix crash (ssl_buckets) when apr_terminate() is called without
clearing connection pool.
r2170: Fix host header when url contains a username or password
r2171: Fix issue #130: HTTP header field names are case insensitive.
r2178+2179: Make serf_bucket_response_wait_for_headers() return APR_SUCCESS
instead of APR_EOF on responses that don't contain a body.
Added r2011 and r20212, needed for r2178,-9. Manual conflict resolution in
test/test_buckets.c for r2011.

author: lgo
msg: On the 1.3.x branch:
Merge serf_get.c changes from trunk:
r2004: handle connections closed by the server.
r2016: Fix compiler warnings.
r2177: Allow HEAD requests without a protocol error.
r2175+r2176: Don't filter the query part of the url.
r2143: Enable serf_get to take extra request headers.

author: ivan
msg: Follow-up to r2178: Type correctness fix.
* buckets/response_buckets.c
(run_machine): Pass NULL as data and 0 as length to
serf_bucket_simple_create() call.

author: rhuijben
msg: Make serf_bucket_response_wait_for_headers() return APR_SUCCESS instead of
APR_EOF on responses that don't contain a body.
Without this patch 'HEAD' requests and some special response statees won't
handle the response headers, because callers (such as the auth subsystem)
will assume that the request is already completed.
This problem was visible in Subversion as 'HEAD' requests returning a 401
response, without trying authorization first.
* buckets/response_buckets.c
(run_machine): Set state to STATE_BODY even when no body is expected as this
state is required to note that we finished reading the headers.
* test/test_auth.c
(test_auth_on_HEAD): New function.
* test/test_util.c
(accept_response): Properly create HEAD requests, by marking them as such.
(setup_request): Allow creating requests without a request body. This is not
necessary for HEAD requests and improves test coverage by not enabling
chunked encoding in the request.

author: rhuijben
msg: Extend serf_get to allow HEAD requests without a protocol error.
* test/serf_get.c
(app_baton_t): Add variable.
(accept_response): For head requests, mark that no body is expected
This matches how Subversion's libsvn_ra_serf marks this kind of requests.
(main): Detect head request.
